result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J. Quinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No contact with the victim (M. M. B.), the victim's family or their residence.
Any other term deemed appropriate by Agent.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Request for civil judgment from DOC  **no paper copy in physical file**
The Defendant is granted to Huber privileges on his imposed probation sentence commencing forthwith.

Defendant Steven J. Quinn in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P. Powers as a friend of the Court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the Defendant's pro-se request for Huber privileges on the his current probation revocation.  The State takes no position on the Defendant's request.  The Court grants the Defendant request and the Defendant is allowed Huber privileges forthwith.
Review hearing on July 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 7/13/16; Denied as not in the interests of justice.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on September 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Steven J. Quinn in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Court swears defendant. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $50.00 per month commencing October 1, 2015. Court will give another date in 3 weeks.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnessor their property listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Steven J. Quinn in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
